page.title: 10AGRICULTURE. S.HEDINGHAM.
page.content: The countryside around Sible Hedingham is rather hilly. Leading down the East side there is the River Colne Valley. The{land}is divided into{fields} with hedges,fences,ditches and foot- paths. The{fields}are brightly covered with Yellow Rape in May-time. There are some{arable fields}but the larger amount of{land}is used for grazing. Near Dynes Hall the{crops}are Stetson Winter Wheat and Fenmon Winter Wheat. Other{crops}that are grown include Corn,Wheat,Beans and Rape. The {grazing land}is mostly grass or weeds. The farmers mostly use tractors and on the back they can use a wide variety of extra equipment for {cultivation.}
